intro: Gonolobus glaziovii, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to purple flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Gonolobus glaziovii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with ample sunlight.
